Description: Combined Systems, Inc., headquartered in Great Neck, N.Y., agreed to pay a $65,000 penalty to settle alleged violations of federal and state hazardous waste regulations at its Jamestown, Pa., facility, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/422ca62286389137852576b9007774d4.html

Description: The Federal Trade Commission reached a settlement requiring major marketers of children's vitamins to stop making false and unproven claims that their supplements promote healthy brain and eye development in children. The companies agreed to pay $2.1 million to provide refunds to consumers who purchased certain multivitamins in their Disney and Marvel Heroes line.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2010/12/ftc-settlement-prohibits-marketers-childrens-vitamins-making

Description: NBTY Inc., a leading manufacturer and distributor of dietary supplements in the United States and abroad, agreed to pay a $2 million civil penalty to settle allegations that it violated the terms of a 1995 FTC order by making false and misleading health claims about two of its products.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2005/10/nbty-inc-pay-2-million-penalty-alleged-violations-ftc-order

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
